data

Class Branch

  • java.lang.Object
    • data.Branch

  • public class Branch
extends java.lang.Object
    A data structure holding information about a branch of the fractal tree.
    Author:
    Jacob Ressler & Anthony Lantz

    • Constructor Detail

      • Branch

        public Branch(Branch parent,
              Vector2 end,
              float angle)
        Creates a branch with the specified parent, end point and angle. Also kickstarts the creation of any children of this branch.

        This constructor is only used by non-root branches.

        Parameters:
        parent - the parent of this branch
        end - the end point of this branch
        angle - the angle of this branch

      • Branch

        public Branch(int length)
        Creates a branch with the specified length. Also kickstarts the creation of any children of this branch.

        This constructor is only used by the root branch.

        Parameters:
        length - length of this branch as a percentage of the canvas dimensions

    • Method Detail

      • split

        private void split(Vector2 start,
                   float phi)
        Calculates the angles and endpoints for this Branch's children and creates them
        Parameters:
        start - the end point of this Branch, which is the start point of its children
        phi - the angle of this Branch

      • calcLength

        private int calcLength(int len)
        Calculate a length based on the given length and current Parameters values.
        Parameters:
        len - a length
        Returns:
        a new length

      • calcStrokeWeight

        private float calcStrokeWeight()
        Calculate a stroke weight for this branch based on current Parameters values.
        Returns:

      • randomRange

        private int randomRange(int i)
        Used with ParamManager's rangeMin and rangeMax arrays. Returns a random value between rangeMin[i] and rangeMax[i].
        Parameters:
        i - the index
        Returns:
        a value between the min and max
